thread.title: What Happens If a Drone Gets Sucked Into a Jet?
thread.title_full: What Happens If a Drone Gets Sucked Into a Jet?

author: senh
title: What Happens If a Drone Gets Sucked Into a Jet?
text: BING NEWS: Jet Engines Have Not Been Tested Against Drone Strikes Close calls between small drones and passenger planes have been skyrocketing, but no tests have been done to determine what would happen if an unmanned craft was sucked into a jet engine. The federal government has long required that planes be tested for ... 08/13/2015 - 9:33 am | View Link NYC travelers' group pushes drone safety measures, tougher penalties for use near airports "To me, it's the biggest safety threat in the U.S. and aviation these days." A drone could shatter an airplane's windshield on impact, Derner said, or get sucked into a jet engine putting crew and passengers in peril. Guy Haggard, a board-certified ... 08/12/2015 - 5:23 pm | View Link Drone flies about 100 feet below nose of airliner in Phoenix "If a drone flies too close to an airplane, there is a chance it can be sucked into an engine, presenting a potential major public safety threat," said Phoenix City Council members Sal DiCiccio and Michael Nowakowski, who is chairman of the Public Safety ... 08/4/2015 - 6:55 pm | View Link Drone drops drugs over prison yard with 200-plus inmates below: Melee ensues This news comes on the heels of drones becoming dangerous pests to airlines after near-misses with 2 planes were reported at JFK Airport this week. This is serious, if a drone is sucked up into an aircraft engine, this could cause a crash. 08/4/2015 - 8:52 am | View Link Pilots On ‘High Alert’ Following Third Drone Sighting In As Many Days At NYC’s JFK Airport “The FAA has to act and toughen up the rules before a tragedy occurs because if a drone were sucked into a jet engine of a plane filled with passengers untold tragedy could result and we do not, do not, do not want that to happen,” Schumer said.
